capital_gains_tax_rates.question: What are the capital gains tax rates in India?
capital_gains_tax_rates.answer: Short-term capital gains (STCG) covered under Section 111A: 20% (15% if transferred before 23-07-2024). Normal STCG: Taxed at normal income tax slab rates. Long-term capital gains (LTCG): Generally 12.5% (20% if transferred before 23-07-2024). LTCG on listed equity shares (Section 112A): 12.5% on gains exceeding Rs 1,25,000.

stcg_rate.question: What is the short term capital gains tax rate?
stcg_rate.answer: STCG under Section 111A (listed equity shares with STT): 20% (15% before 23-07-2024). Other STCG: Taxed at applicable income tax slab rates.

ltcg_rate.question: What is the long term capital gains tax rate?
ltcg_rate.answer: LTCG is generally taxed at 12.5% (20% if asset transferred before 23-07-2024). For listed equity shares under Section 112A: 12.5% on gains exceeding Rs 1,25,000.

section_80c.question: What is Section 80C?
section_80c.answer: Section 80C allows deductions up to Rs 1,50,000 for investments including: Life insurance premiums, PPF contributions, EPF/VPF, NSC, ELSS, tuition fees for 2 children, principal repayment on home loan, Sukanya Samriddhi Account, NPS Tier-I, and 5-year tax-saving FDs.

gst_rates_restaurants.question: What is the GST rate for restaurants?
gst_rates_restaurants.answer: GST rates for restaurants: 5% (without ITC) for restaurants not serving alcohol. 18% (with ITC) for restaurants in hotels with room tariff Rs 7,500 or more per day. 18% (with ITC) for restaurants serving alcohol.

standard_deduction.question: What is the standard deduction for salaried employees?
standard_deduction.answer: Standard deduction for salaried employees is Rs 50,000 per year from gross salary income. This deduction is available for both old and new tax regimes.

section_24.question: What is Section 24 deduction?
section_24.answer: Section 24 allows deduction of interest paid on home loan: Up to Rs 2,00,000 per year for self-occupied property. No limit for let-out property. Pre-construction interest is allowed in 5 equal installments.

gst_definition.question: What is GST?
gst_definition.answer: GST (Goods and Services Tax) is a comprehensive indirect tax on supply of goods and services in India. It replaced multiple taxes like VAT, excise duty, and service tax. GST has three components: CGST (Central GST), SGST (State GST), and IGST (Integrated GST for inter-state transactions).

input_tax_credit.question: What is input tax credit?
input_tax_credit.answer: Input Tax Credit (ITC) under GST allows businesses to reduce their tax liability by claiming credit for GST paid on purchases/inputs. The tax paid on inputs can be set off against tax payable on outputs, preventing cascading effect of taxes.

stcg_vs_ltcg.question: What is the difference between STCG and LTCG?
stcg_vs_ltcg.answer: STCG (Short-Term Capital Gains): Gains from assets held for â‰¤12 months (24 months for property). Taxed at 20% under Section 111A for equity, or at slab rates otherwise. LTCG (Long-Term Capital Gains): Gains from assets held for >12 months (24 months for property). Taxed at 12.5% generally, with Rs 1,25,000 exemption for equity under Section 112A.

surcharge.question: What is surcharge in income tax?
surcharge.answer: Surcharge is an additional tax levied on high-income taxpayers: 10% surcharge if income is Rs 50 lakhs to Rs 1 crore. 15% surcharge if income is Rs 1 crore to Rs 2 crore. 25% surcharge if income is Rs 2 crore to Rs 5 crore. 37% surcharge if income exceeds Rs 5 crore.

cess.question: What is cess in income tax?
cess.answer: Health and Education Cess is 4% charged on the total of income tax plus surcharge. It is used to fund health and education initiatives by the government. Cess is applicable to all taxpayers regardless of income level.

section_111a.question: What is Section 111A?
section_111a.answer: Section 111A covers taxation of short-term capital gains on equity shares, equity-oriented mutual funds, and units of business trust where STT is paid. Tax rate is 20% (15% if transferred before 23-07-2024).

section_112a.question: What is Section 112A?
section_112a.answer: Section 112A covers taxation of long-term capital gains exceeding Rs 1,25,000 from listed equity shares and equity-oriented mutual funds where STT is paid. Tax rate is 12.5% (10% if transferred before 23-07-2024).

income_tax_slabs.question: What are income tax slabs?
income_tax_slabs.answer: New Tax Regime (2025-26): Rs 0-3 lakhs: Nil, Rs 3-7 lakhs: 5%, Rs 7-10 lakhs: 10%, Rs 10-12 lakhs: 15%, Rs 12-15 lakhs: 20%, Above Rs 15 lakhs: 30%. Old Tax Regime: Rs 0-2.5 lakhs: Nil, Rs 2.5-5 lakhs: 5%, Rs 5-10 lakhs: 20%, Above Rs 10 lakhs: 30%. Standard deduction of Rs 50,000 available in both regimes.

tax_rate_above_10_lakhs.question: What is the tax rate for income above 10 lakhs?
tax_rate_above_10_lakhs.answer: New Tax Regime: 15% for Rs 10-12 lakhs, 20% for Rs 12-15 lakhs, 30% for above Rs 15 lakhs. Old Tax Regime: 30% for income above Rs 10 lakhs. Additional surcharge applies on income above Rs 50 lakhs, and 4% health and education cess on total tax.

section_80e.question: What is Section 80E?
section_80e.answer: Section 80E provides deduction for interest paid on education loan taken for higher education. The deduction is available for interest paid on loan taken for self, spouse, or children. There is no upper limit on the deduction amount, and it can be claimed for up to 8 years or until the interest is fully repaid, whichever is earlier.

presumptive_taxation.question: What is presumptive taxation?
presumptive_taxation.answer: Presumptive taxation is a simplified tax scheme under Sections 44AD, 44ADA, and 44AE for small businesses and professionals. It allows taxpayers to declare income at a presumed rate (6-8% of turnover for business, 50% for professionals) without maintaining detailed books of accounts. Eligible for businesses with turnover up to Rs 2 crore and professionals with receipts up to Rs 50 lakhs.

who_can_opt_presumptive.question: Who can opt for presumptive taxation?
who_can_opt_presumptive.answer: Individuals, HUFs, and partnership firms (not LLPs) can opt for presumptive taxation. Section 44AD: Businesses with turnover up to Rs 2 crore (except transport business). Section 44ADA: Professionals (doctors, lawyers, engineers, architects, etc.) with gross receipts up to Rs 50 lakhs. Section 44AE: Transport business with up to 10 goods carriages.

gst_rates.question: What are GST rates?
gst_rates.answer: GST has four main rate slabs: 5% (essential items like food grains, healthcare), 12% (processed food, computers), 18% (most goods and services, capital goods, IT services), and 28% (luxury items, tobacco, automobiles). Some items are exempt (0%), and certain goods attract additional cess. Specific rates vary by HSN/SAC codes.

freelance_income_tax.question: how is freelance income taxed in India?
freelance_income_tax.answer: Freelance income in India is treated as business/professional income under Section 44AA of the Income Tax Act. Taxed at applicable income tax slab rates (5% to 30% based on total income). Can opt for Presumptive Taxation under Section 44ADA if receipts < Rs 50 lakhs (50% of receipts deemed as income). Must maintain books of accounts if receipts exceed Rs 25 lakhs. Can claim business expenses as deductions (internet, equipment, office rent, etc.). Advance tax must be paid if liability exceeds Rs 10,000. TDS applicable under Section 194J (10%) or 194C (1-2%) depending on nature of service.

tax_audit_requirement.question: when is tax audit required?
tax_audit_requirement.answer: Tax audit under Section 44AB is mandatory: Business with turnover exceeding Rs 1 crore (Rs 10 crore if cash < 5%). Profession with gross receipts exceeding Rs 50 lakhs. Presumptive taxation if profit claimed is lower than presumptive rates. Transfer pricing if international transactions exceed Rs 1 crore. Tax audit report in Form 3CA/3CB must be filed by September 30th. Penalty: Rs 1.5 lakh (or 0.5% of turnover, whichever is lower) for non-compliance.

tds_rates_salary.question: what are the TDS rates for salary?
tds_rates_salary.answer: TDS on salary (Section 192) is deducted as per income tax slab rates. New Tax Regime: 0% up to Rs 3L, 5% (Rs 3-7L), 10% (Rs 7-10L), 15% (Rs 10-12L), 20% (Rs 12-15L), 30% (above Rs 15L). Old Tax Regime: 0% up to Rs 2.5L, 5% (Rs 2.5-5L), 20% (Rs 5-10L), 30% (above Rs 10L). Standard deduction Rs 50,000 allowed. Surcharge: 10-37% on high incomes. Health & Education Cess: 4% on tax plus surcharge.

itr_filing_deadline.question: what is the deadline for filing income tax return?
itr_filing_deadline.answer: ITR filing deadlines for FY 2024-25: Individual/HUF (non-audit) by July 31, 2025. Business with tax audit by October 31, 2025. Transfer pricing report by November 30, 2025. Revised return within 24 months. Belated return by December 31, 2025. Late filing fee: Rs 5,000 (Rs 1,000 if income < Rs 5 lakhs). Interest under Section 234A: 1% per month on tax due.
